Interface Expression

All Known Implementing Classes:
Divides, Minus, MyNumber, Operation, Plus, Times
public interface Expression
Expression is an abstract class that represents arithmetic expressions. It has two concrete subclasses Operation and MyNumber.
See Also:
  • Operation
  • MyNumber

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    accept(Visitor v)
    accept is a method needed to implement the visitor design pattern
    int
    countDepth()
    Counts the depth of nested expressions in an arithmetic expression
    int
    countNbs()
    Counts the number of values recursively contained in an arithmetic expression
    int
    countOps()
    Counts the number of operations recursively contained in an arithmetic expression

      accept is a method needed to implement the visitor design pattern
      Parameters:
      v - The visitor object being passed as a parameter
